lcInstruction.p: The conref attribute allows you to pull content from a single element (and its content) into another topic.

If you want to pull a sequence of two or more elements into a topic, you can use the conrefend attribute in combination with the conref attribute. The two attributes specify the starting and ending elements in a sequence of elements. All element, including the starting and ending elements are pulled into the referencing topic.
If you use conrefend, keep in mind that:

ul.li:
Both of the elements identified by the conref and conrefend attributes must be the same element name as the referencing element. For instance, if the referencing element is a

element, the elements indicated by the conref and conrefend attributes must also be

elements.

The elements that occur between the elements indicated by the conref and conrefend attribute do not have to be the type. Thus, in the preceding example, if there were or elements between the first and last

elements, those elements would be included in the content reference.

lcInstruction.p: You can also use conrefend with conkeyrefs. If conrefend is combined with a conkeyref, the filename in the conrefend attribute is ignored and is replaced with the filename used by the key specified in the conkeyref.
